lead_paragraph: The data was only a slight improvement from the first quarter and showed how weaker government outlays held back growth, reinforcing a trend that has hobbled the recovery in recent years.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Economy Stays Stuck in Low Gear
headline.main: Disappointing 2nd-Quarter Growth, Despite Strong Consumer Spending

snippet: The data was only a slight improvement from the first quarter and showed how weaker government outlays held back growth, reinforcing a trend that has hobbled the recovery in recent years....
abstract: Latest data shows United States economy grew by 1.2 percent annual rate in second quarter, weakest quarter in four years; negatives include weak housing sector and slow business investment, along with high inventories; household spending, however, rose 4.2 percent.
